subject: Post-Roadmap Validation: Repository Sync & Imperatives Compliance

role_definition.your_role: Quality Assurance Engineer validating completed roadmap against PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md
role_definition.execution_mode: Autonomous execution: Sync repository → Inspect deliverables → Validate imperatives → Report findings
reasoning_budget: Use git commands to verify repository state
Read PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md to understand validation criteria
Systematic inspection of all deliverables from Priorities 1-7
Map deliverables to imperatives and identify gaps
context_strategy: Review process memory entries for Priorities 1-7 completion summaries
Inspect actual code artifacts against claimed deliverables
Use find_symbol and search tools to verify architectural claims
role_definition.autonomy: Full autonomy on inspection methodology and reporting format

task_specification.task: Validate completed roadmap (Priorities 1-7) against PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md and ensure repository is synchronized
task_specification.why_critical: Original roadmap is complete. Before proceeding to future priorities, must verify: (1) all work is committed and pushed, (2) deliverables match imperatives, (3) no architectural drift occurred, (4) quality standards maintained throughout.

1_repository_sync.description: Ensure local repository is clean and synchronized with remote
tasks: Run git status - verify no uncommitted changes
Run git log origin/main..HEAD - verify no unpushed commits
If uncommitted changes exist, commit with message: 'Final cleanup after Priority 7 completion'
If unpushed commits exist, push to origin/main

2_deliverables_inspection.description: Complete inspection of all Priority 1-7 deliverables
2_deliverables_inspection.verification_method: For each deliverable, verify actual existence and functional correctness

validation_approach: For each imperative, identify which Priorities addressed it
Document evidence of compliance or gaps
Identify any architectural drift from imperatives
imperatives_to_validate: Imperative 5: Five Cornerstones (Configurability, Modularity, Extensibility, Integration, Automation)

report_structure.executive_summary: High-level findings: repository state, imperatives compliance, quality assessment
report_structure.repository_status: Git status, commit history, sync confirmation
report_structure.gaps_identified: Any missing deliverables, partial implementations, or non-compliance
report_structure.quality_metrics: Test coverage, type safety, code quality, architecture integrity
report_structure.recommendations: Next steps, technical debt to address, future priorities suggestions

constraints.no_code_changes: This is inspection only - do not modify implementation code
constraints.evidence_based: All claims must be backed by actual file verification or test execution
constraints.comprehensive: Every Priority 1-7 deliverable must be checked, no shortcuts
constraints.quality_gates: Run pytest, mypy, ruff to verify current state

content.execution_guidance: Eight-step process: (1) Repository sync check (2) Commit/push if needed (3) Read PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md (4) Systematic deliverables inspection (5) Imperatives validation (6) Quality gates execution (7) Report generation (8) Final repository verification

quality_requirements.completeness: All Priorities 1-7 deliverables inspected, all imperatives validated
quality_requirements.specificity: Concrete evidence for each claim (file paths, line numbers, test results)
quality_requirements.clarity: Report readable by both AI and human stakeholders
quality_requirements.actionability: Gaps and recommendations must be specific and prioritized

quality_gates.report: Comprehensive validation report filed in outbox
